Guests: Long term guests should contribute to the grocery fund; they should send an email for transparency.
Travel: When you travel out of town, make arrangements for your chores to be done.
Conservation: Keep water waste to an absolute minimum (e.g. if it's yellow, let it mellow; take short showers).
Turn off lights if they're not needed.
Meals and Food: After dinner, everyone pitches in to clean up. That includes counters, leftovers, dishes, and sweeping.
Label the contents of leftovers, especially those with meat.
Store food in the fridge in covered transparent containers.
Kitchen: Clean up after yourself. Wipe down counters and table, and keep the sink free of dishes.
Squeeze water out of sponges after use and put them on the windowsill, not the counter.
Keep pots, knives, and other sharp items out of the dishwasher.
Use knives only on cutting boards, not on glass, metal, or the counter.
Be vigilant about fruit flies and ants; cover food, especially sweets, and close the compost bin lid.
Keep sharp items out of the drying rack. Knives can go on the magnetic holder while still wet.
Don't use metal on metal (e.g. metal spoons in metal pots).
Around the Horse: Clean the hair out of the shower and sink drains.
Open and close doors quietly, with care. Especially pay attention in downstairs bedrooms and the bathroom.
Minimize personal belongings you keep in common space, especially fragile items like instruments.
Security: Be security smart: lock the front door when nobody is upstairs, and lock windows/sliding door when you go out.
Peace of Mind: Be mindful in the morning. (Quiet, please.)
Don't share Melissa's Essex code with anyone (lest we lose access due to misuse by your friends' friends' friends).
